text: [Music]
hi this is Brian with Amazon Web
Services and in this session we're gonna
take a look at parameter store part of
ec2 Systems Manager in parameter store
what we do is we take care of your
credentials and other important things
like product keys and we store them in a
single spot by doing this we can easily
secure your credentials for scripts and
in those scripts let's say we want to
update that I may have a hundred
different scripts with the administrator
password in that and instead of having
to go and change that in those scripts
and even having a security issue with
people being able to access those
scripts will refer to the parameter
store which means I can update it all in
one place very quickly and not have to
touch a single script the other piece
about the parameter store is I can store
this information in a secure fashion so
if I want to I can encrypt that data and
have an extra layer of security using
your own kms keys in the parameter store
there's it's really easy to access the
data from run command from state manager
and from automation Service if I need to
access that data from anywhere else I
can use the Amazon command line
interface and I can access that from my
desktop from inside other applications
as long as you use that command line
interface and tie it in to your account
you can access it anywhere so this was
the ec2 Systems Manager parameter store
and in the next video I'll take a demo
of and show you how to use it and set it
up thanks for watching
[Music]
